com.example.cs246project.kindergartenprepapp

Class MediaModel<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.cs246project.kindergartenprepapp.MediaModel<T>

  • public class MediaModel<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for holding and managing image/audio file references.

    Since:
    2017-03-09
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dan Rix

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MediaModel(int imageFileResourceIndex, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> audioFileResourceIndexes, T value)
      Non-Default Constructor Constructs a MediaModel with image/audio resources and an associated value

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getAudioSourceIndex()
      Get Audio Source Index Gets the current audio resource index from _audioFileResourceIndexes and then increments the _currentAudioResourceIndex so clients use audio resources in succession.
      int getImageFileResourceIndex()
      Get Image File Resource Index Getter for the _imageFileResourceIndex.
      T getValue()
      Get Value Getter for the _value.
      boolean hasAudio()
      Has Audio Flag to know if there are any audio resources at all.
      boolean isAtEndOfAudio()
      Is At End Of Audio Has the client successively gone through all the audio resources?
      void resetAudioIndex()
      Reset Audio Index Set the _currentAudioResourceIndex back to 0.

      • getAudioSourceIndex

        public int getAudioSourceIndex()
        Get Audio Source Index Gets the current audio resource index from _audioFileResourceIndexes and then increments the _currentAudioResourceIndex so clients use audio resources in succession.

        Is At End Of Audio Has the client successively gone through all the audio resources?
        Returns:
